page.title: 07Thame Industry 1-B.O.C.
page.content: One of the exciting industrial develop- ments in Thame is the new 15 million pound plant recently built for BOC. It has all the latest technological advancements and replaces the 80 year old plant. The company separates liquid oxygen and nitrogen from the air and sells it to over 400 customers in the south-east. Oxygen becomes a liquid at -182 deg C and is used for burning. Nitrogen is liquid at -187 deg C and is used for freezing. In a day 28 tons of oxygen and 100 tons of nitrogen can be produced. 100 litres of oxygen costs 30 pounds and the equivalent nitrogen costs 4 pounds. 50 people are employed at the plant, half of them being drivers. The old plant is being demolished and will be used as a transport depot. We saw a demonstration of steel cutting using the oxygen- acetylene cutter. (see photograph)
